fields.title: Harris 1976 France Government Survey, study no. 2621

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue:
Survey examines attitudes toward France, its government, leaders, and products.

Questions focus on France as a world power, its image, U.S.-French relations, its nuclear technology, leadership, social climate, and labor force. Views of general public sample on current events including presidential preference, Alaskan resources, welfare, championship sports, and former President Nixon's trip to China were examined.

fields.notesText: Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Harris used a random multi-stage cluster sampling design to obtain a national cross-section sample of the U.S. population 18 years and over. A cross-section sample of national leaders was also collected. Attitudes on various topics were collected by questionnaire in a face- to-face interview; "U.S. adults 18 years and over; National leaders"; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-2621;

distributor.distributorName: Louis Harris Data Center, University of North Carolina
